line_1: And trust to butter and to cream
line_2: St. Dominic said in a dream

line_1: Yon peach be curds, and yon drop water cream;
line_2: While apples sliced a dumpling well may seem,

line_1: O'er strawberry beds in deluges of Cream!
line_2: Resign his majesty of mud, and stream

line_1: Flakes of ice that she finds in the cream.
line_2: And they send forth their breath like a steam:

line_1: And, fill'd with harden'd Curds and Cream,
line_2: Think the whole Dairy made for them.

line_1: Singing and scrubbing midst her milk and cream,
line_2: The clatt'ring dairy-maid immers'd in steam,

line_1: Slow rolls the churn, its load of clogging cream
line_2: At once foregoes its quality and name;

line_1: Hence Suffolk dairy-wives run mad for cream,
line_2: And leave their milk with nothing but its name;

line_1: Best to demand the name of good thick cream!
line_2: And shining tin-flasks of new milk, which seem

line_1: A pan of milk, unskimm'd its cream,
line_2: Did next receive the bounteous stream;
